chatter: Expedia has grown into one of the largest online travel agencies in the world by returning to its technology roots.
whatitdoes: Through more than a dozen different brands — Expedia.com, Hotels.com, Hotwire.com, CarRentals.com, Tavelocity — Expedia allows travelers to research, plan and book travel around the world.
setsapart: Bulked up to become the largest online travel company in the U.S., and the world’s second largest, by buying smaller competitors.
caption: A plane lands at SeaTac International Airport.

chatter: Despite changes in their industy and changes in their offerings, F5 Networks continues seeing steady growth.
whatitdoes: Offers software and hardware that optimizes application delivery and security over data networks.
setsapart: More than 50 percent market share in the application delivery controller market.
caption: The data center at F5's Seattle headquarters.

chatter: In acquiring a company amid a growing industry and diversifying demand, 2014 proved to be a successful year for memory giant Micron Technology.
whatitdoes: Makes semiconductor memory components such as DRAM and NAND flash memory chips, as well as a variety of solid state drives.
setsapart: No. 1 broadest memory chip and drive portfolio in their industry, with over 20,000 patents.
caption: CEO Mark Durcan at company headquarters.

chatter: Retirement investments represent half of Bellevue insurance company Symetra’s revenue.
whatitdoes: Provides life insurance, employee benefits and retirement investments through brokers, agents and banks.
setsapart: Intensely focused on building national brand awareness for key lines of business.
caption: Symetra's headquarters in downtown Bellevue.

setsapart: Sheer size, diversity of lines of business and longevity.
caption: Aerial shot of the Microsoft campus in Redmond.
